html.div:
The contents of this dashboard relate to the Clustering (sometimes called Index Replication) feature of Splunk. This is available in versions of Splunk starting with 5.0.
Note: Environments not making use of clustering will simply not have any replicated data shown on the graphs.
The first two rows of panels represent configuration data. Most promiment is the mode of the selected host. For the field repFactor, a value of auto indicates that the system-wide setting should be honored.
Numerical data on the third row is broken out to give show the amount of disk space consumed by index buckets arising locally (that is, data indexed natively by this host), vs buckets which are replicated from other nodes in the cluster. In this way, it's possible to see the overall impact of clustering on the disk storage requirements.
The pie chart in the bottom left is broken out by the splunk_server field of the indexer which originally indexed the data (this name can be, but is not required to be, the hostname of the system).
On the bottom right is a time-trended graph showing the relative proportion of data indexed locally by the selected indexer, compared to the amount of data being replicated to this indexer from other members of the cluster.

single.title: Locally Indexed Data
single.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | search NOT bucket_type="rb" | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS indexed | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(indexed)`

single.title: Replicated Data
single.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | search bucket_type="rb" | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS replicated | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(replicated)`

single.title: Total (Local + Replicated)
single.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS Total | `_fb_mbytes_pretty(Total)`

chart.title: Source of Indexed Data
chart.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | extract auto=f fb_extract_hot_bucket | eval guid=bucket_primary_guid | join type=left guid [ | rest /services/server/info | rename splunk_server AS host ] | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by path, host | stats sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS MBytes by host

chart.title: Local vs. Replicated Data Over Time (last 30 days)
chart.searchString: `_fb_summary_recs($host$, $index$)` | extract auto=f fb_extract_bucket_type_time_source | extract auto=f fb_extract_hot_bucket | bucket _time span=1d | stats max(sizeOnDiskMB) AS sizeOnDiskMB by _time, path, bucket_type | eval bucket_type=if(bucket_type=="rb", "Replicated", "Indexed") | timechart span=1d sum(sizeOnDiskMB) AS "Disk Usage" by bucket_type
